questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: I wanted to go, but it was raining.
I wanted to go, but it rained.
I wanted to go but, it was raining.
I wanted to go but it was raining.
questions.explanation: Coordinating conjunction 'but' joins two independent clauses without a comma when short: 'but it was raining'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: He studied hard, so he passed.
He studied hard so he passed.
He studied hard, so passed he.
He studied hard so passed he.
questions.explanation: 'So' joins two independent clauses and requires a comma before it: 'studied hard, so he passed'.

questions.question: Select the correct conjunction:
options: She was tired, ______ she went to bed.
questions.explanation: 'So' (result) fits; the full sentence is 'tired, so she went to bed'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: Do you want tea, or coffee?
Do you want tea or, coffee?
Do you want tea or coffee?
Do you want tea, or coffee?
questions.explanation: No comma before 'or' in short alternative questions: 'tea or coffee?'.

questions.question: Select the correct subordinating conjunction:
questions.explanation: 'Although' shows contrast: 'Although it was late, we stayed'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: I will call you ______ I arrive.
questions.explanation: 'When' introduces time clauses: 'I will call you when I arrive'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: He didn't come ______ he was sick.
questions.explanation: 'Because' gives reason: 'didn't come because he was sick'.

questions.explanation: 'If' introduces condition: 'If you don't study, you will fail' (implied negative).

questions.question: Choose the correct pair of conjunctions:
options: Not only he is smart, but also hardworking.
Not only is he smart, but also hardworking.
Not only he is smart but also, hardworking.
Not only is he smart but also hardworking.
questions.explanation: Inversion with 'not only': 'Not only is he smart, but he is also hardworking'.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
questions.explanation: 'But' shows contrast: 'rich but unhappy'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: He was tired, ______ he finished the work.
questions.explanation: 'But' shows unexpected result despite being tired.

questions.question: Select the correct conjunction for time:
options: ______ I finish, I will call you.
questions.explanation: 'After' indicates sequence: 'After I finish, I will call you'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
questions.explanation: 'Either... or' presents alternatives: 'Either you come, or you stay'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: ______ he was poor, he was happy.
questions.explanation: 'Although' expresses contrast: 'Although he was poor, he was happy'.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: I can't go out ______ I finish my homework.
questions.explanation: 'Until' indicates time condition: 'until I finish my homework'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
questions.explanation: 'If' for condition: 'She will pass if she studies'.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
questions.explanation: 'If' for conditional offers: 'If you need help, call me'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: We stayed inside ______ it was raining.
questions.explanation: 'Because' gives reason for the action.

questions.question: Choose the correct correlative conjunction:
questions.explanation: 'Both... and' joins two subjects: 'Both he and she came'.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: ______ I was young, I lived in Delhi.
questions.explanation: 'When' for past time clauses: 'When I was young, I lived in Delhi'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: I like tea, ______ I prefer coffee.
questions.explanation: 'But' shows preference contrast: 'like tea, but prefer coffee'.

questions.question: Select the correct conjunction:
options: ______ it was expensive, he bought it.
questions.explanation: 'Although' for concession (despite expense).

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: You can stay here, ______ you pay rent.
questions.explanation: 'If' for condition: 'if you pay rent'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: He ran fast ______ he missed the bus.
questions.explanation: 'So' shows result: 'ran fast so he missed the bus' (implying 'but').

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: ______ raining heavily, we cancelled the picnic.
questions.explanation: 'Because of' for reason with gerund/noun: 'Because of raining heavily'.

questions.question: Choose the correct pair:
options: Neither the teacher ______ the students knew the answer.
questions.explanation: 'Neither... nor' for negative alternatives: 'Neither the teacher nor the students'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: ______ you help me, I will do it alone.
questions.explanation: 'Unless' means 'if not': 'Unless you help me, I will do it alone'.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: He is tall ______ his brother is short.
questions.explanation: 'But' contrasts two facts: 'tall but his brother is short'.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: ______ the traffic was bad, we arrived on time.
questions.explanation: 'Although' shows unexpected positive result despite negative condition.
